availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard King, Jr. (Harrison Co., Kentucky, farmer and hotel keeper)

body.p: Harrison Co., Kentucky, farmer and hotel keeper. Kentucky native. Son of Richard King and Cynthia Crawford King. Married to Margaret A. McKinley King in Harrison County, Kentucky, on February 21, 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Hotel keeper in Harrison County in 1860. Employed Joseph Lefevre as a laborer in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 119B.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #001690281, p. 208.
KYR-0001-017-0171.
